alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Carbon and west central Albany Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Elk Mountain to near Arlington. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 240 and 289. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
